title: What substance is naturally in water which is not a mineral salt nor harmful? - Quora

response.answer_text: Small amounts of Carbon dioxide, argon, oxygen and nitrogen from the atmosphere dissolve in the water. Solubility of Gases in Water depending where the water is from there might be some tannin or lignin from rotting plants that turn the water brown or yellow, totally harmless of course but not good looking. https://www.watersystemscouncil.org/download/wellcare_information_sheets/potential_groundwater_contaminant_information_sheets/96111501_Tannins.pdf

“What substance is naturally in water which is not a mineral salt nor harmful?” There are traces of all atmospheric gases dissolved in water, the most important of which is Oxygen. Dissolved Oxygen makes it possible for aquatic creatures (fish, etc) to live (“breathe”) in water — by using specialized organs (gills) to absorb oxygen from the water and to transfer (“exhale”)carbon dioxide back to the water.
